intro: Apodocephala angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed apodocephala, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
